title: 115_hr2243
content: The "Health Equity and Access for Returning Troops and Servicemembers Act" or the "HEARTS Act" modifies the requirement for certain former members of the Armed Forces to enroll in Medicare Part B to be eligible for Tricare for Life. The "HEARTS Act" amends TRICARE eligibility by exempting certain individuals from enrolling in Medicare Part B to qualify for Tricare for Life if they are under 65 years old and not entitled to specific Social Security benefits. The "HEARTS Act" amends TRICARE eligibility by exempting certain individuals from enrolling in Medicare Part B to qualify for Tricare for Life if they are under 65 years old and not entitled to specific Social Security benefits. The Act also requires coordination between the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Health and Human Services to provide information and counseling to individuals whose entitlement to certain benefits has terminated due to substantial gainful activity. The subsection is amended to exempt certain individuals from enrolling in Medicare Part B for Tricare for Life eligibility. Coordination between the Secretary of Defense and Health and Human Services is required to provide information and counseling to affected individuals. The subsection is amended to exempt certain individuals from enrolling in Medicare Part B for Tricare for Life eligibility. A report on the implementation of the amendment must be submitted by the Secretary of Defense, Secretary of Health and Human Services, and Commissioner of Social Security to relevant committees within one year of enactment. The report must include the number of individuals enrolled in TRICARE for Life not in Medicare Part B due to a specific provision, and the number of retired Armed Forces members entitled to Medicare Part A benefits after 24 months. The amendments made by this section apply to individuals no longer enrolled in TRICARE plans under chapter 55 of title 10, United States Code, who meet the criteria in section 1086(d)(6)(B) of title 10, United States Code.
